Key Arguments: The legislation could be used to silence dissenting opinions and promote government agendas.
Individuals should have the freedom to access information from multiple sources and think critically.
The definition of harm is vague and could lead to government overreach.
Freedom of speech is essential in a democracy, and existing laws already address issues like incitement to violence.
International complications could arise from enforcing this legislation on digital platforms operated outside Australia.
Notable Quotes: Information is just information. It is neither good nor bad in and of itself, much like a knife, or a rifle.
Freedom of speech is paramount in a fully functioning democracy.
It is unnecessary to introduce more top-down authoritarian legislation telling us what we can and cannot say, hear, see or listen to.
